> [wanditoast](#comment_6_1LJMKSLPgM8fqQSMRrLzWB2DhVm1zoEVfZ): Ok I set uipassword and multiuser . So as I start zeronet.exe internet explorer starts and connects to it. 1526895582_12uaobyUhg6H9rh88Ryu1x8xrJWBn.body: wont be a thing for some time, as payment system are not really possible to be decentralized for now

> [y3z](#comment_1_1BsusbGKX6JotDgsF1KBebHSZJA7Hd9mGs): The openbazaar.org client is capable of handling your request in a secure manor. Zeronet is not.

zeronet is decentralized+distributed, and generally isnt made for payment specific protocol
openbazaar is dedicated with built in protocol to deal with payment so it's expected
they both uses optional tor for anonymity
openbazaar seling system is centralized for the time begin(they plan to change that)you need to be online to sell/for people to buy your stuff [source](https://github.com/OpenBazaar/OpenBazaar-Server/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions#do-i-need-to-be-online-to-sell-items), personally it's a bad idea as it depend on a signle point of failure, but i doubt it is possible

> [version](#comment_36_15PkTh9DC2wPmrGrQoYVQ6xJLobdanakd4): You can pay BitCoin to ZeroNet site's address, the site owner can receive your payment.

receiving payment!=payment system, it's more like a donation and theres no escrow or intention for owner to sent back the thing you purchased

1527351127_19Qid9uyfWCTmx2cUpDboEKCscRd4.body:
Personally no, we cant enforce ban on something or anything without slowly becoming the new "clearnet BUT with extra steps"

> [Tor Project Blog](https://blog.torproject.org/tor-project-defends-human-rights-racists-oppose):  We feel this way any time the Tor network and software are used for vile purposes. **But we can't build free and open source tools** that protect journalists, human rights activists, and ordinary people around the world **if we also control who uses those tools**. **Tor is designed to defend human rights and privacy by preventing anyone from censoring things, even us.**

> [styromaniac](#comment_33_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): It should be about consent.

yes, if party consented to such action in good faith that they made the choice voluntarily
i dont see how this can go wrong, in my own book if everyone consented there's nothing morally wrong in that said action(of course consent is harder to enforce then arbitrary long lines of stuff to enforce)

people often throw out "only certain age can consent" which honestly make no sense, yes they might not be wisest but that dosent mean someone can just go in and take away their rights to make a choice

> [vanadium](#comment_2_19Qid9uyfWCTmx2cUpDboEKCscRd4fRWrL):  I (in theory!) can certainly imagine ways of making child porn that would not do any harm to the child. Neither physical or psychological.

Yes but what about consent?
yes you can do that without any harm on them but what will they think in the future?
where people take pictures of them and share onto the internet without asking them?
You might be able to not cause harm onto them but that dosent mean it's all good, there's more to conder

> [vanadium](#comment_4_19Qid9uyfWCTmx2cUpDboEKCscRd4fRWrL): That is, to see sex as some kind of free time activity a kid can do, just like tennis, playing instruments, art classes or what else there is for kids. I'm not saying that all kids will like it, it would depend on their personality, some kids won't like it and move on to piano or tennis. What fascinates me by this is: Imagine yourself being a kid again, would you have minded joining a 'sex-club'? Would you regret it now if you had done so?
For me, I think, the answer is no, I wouldn't have minded that. That of course is not to say I would have enjoyed it, but I really don't think I would have regretted it.

I probably wouldnt mind if it's not forced, just like how parent might get you to learn sports but it's up to you to experience and choose to continue it, still a i wont consent people taking picture of me and sharing it onto the internet with is another topic
But probably a very very long shot if you consider most people's thought and would go against it simply because it havent done before, and it "feels wrong" despite everyone participating isnt forced, and clearly understand everything that's ongoing and can choose to stop instantly,
Somehow if it involve child it will "feel wrong" to most people,
And some fall back to reasonings like "child cant make choices because age" "they might regret it"(yes everyone make choices and regret it so does this mean no one can make choices?)

(one side note i like about this place is we can have civil discussions on quite controversial topic without fear of anything(since it's decentralized) and most times people can keep their cool and dont resort to throwing insults but respond with rational constructive arguments)

> [xinyi](#comment_2_15kHQPHwsB18wZyPVftd49ZBdncgdTmA4f): We cannot ban child porn without creating tools that can be used to ban everything. What we can do is 'block' child porn and prevent it from spreading. We should have blocklists as are in ad blockers. There can be blocklists of malware, spam, porn, gore etc. Anyone can apply these blocklists but no one can be forced. [...]

> [styromaniac](#comment_49_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): Blacklist sharing will happen eventually.

How will it be made is the question, most people worries about centralization of trust in said blocklist provider

> [xinyi](#comment_3_15kHQPHwsB18wZyPVftd49ZBdncgdTmA4f): In most ad blockers you can add link to text file hosted on web urls and local computer. Text files are downloaded and updated every day. Every url is scanned and blocked if found in list. [...]

While on clearnet it's acceptable that only few person have control of the "block list"
here, it's not the same, if i disagree on you blocking the site, i will just fork yours and advertise mine with reason why you should use mine not his, and then all hell will break loose, we will end up with millions of blocklist because everyone disagree with everyone on if one which sites should be blocked or not
Which is why i think this wont work without some sort of self/community moderating system

like drug market, like any sort of movement that said country against ex journalism

1528080237_1PMuHrGm4GFBBNbvRgr8zvyyRTc3r.body:
while i am not fully against, i see the worst case scenario of DISTRIBUTED monopolies and it should be avoided
remember the net neutrality slow/fast lane problem? well that's what we will create here by doing just that!!
and i will also explain how it could be made.
 
let's set the scene:
premise 1: all nodes are in interest of own their own profit
premise 2: all nodes will act selfishly to achieve such goals
conclusion: we will form a distributed "cartile" where all file owners will rack up their prices in unison to match others

now one can conclude in such scenario, someone will decided to drop the price for all these money of the desperate users, yes but you are wrong it dosent work that way...

we assume now bob decided to drop 50% from the average fees
we can safely assume that under premise 1, all nodes will react the same way
result: now bob dosent earn all these money he wished, and the users didnt get FUNNELED into him, and he also earns less
conclusion: dropping prices is bad for yourself and permise 2 will stop bob from dropping the price in the beginning if he realize the outcome that he earn nothing from it other then worst pays

Of course this is the disaster scenario, since now we all shift to financial incentive from moral duty
and the only way to break it is to break the 2 premises and also have said file,

say carol has the file and choose to uphold moral duty over financial incentive
all carol has to do is to set selling their file for free(or nearly cheap) and choose not to take the possibly large sum of money that could be earnt

but as long as carol is there, the whole network of nodes are useless, no one will pay for seeding IF you can get it for free,
we assume all these new users who just got the file 50% of them choose to seed for free while 50% of them choose to seed for small money,
the end result is a huge ignored network, all the nodes that cost money will get no traffic simply because there's large amount of free seeders

and that's how NOT to use the financial incentive system!
remember bitcoin?
do you mine because you are nice and willing to contribute to the network?
do you resist the temptation of mounting an 51% attack to the network because you are nice?

no, you mine because you want money, and you dont mount an 51% attack because it will cost you shit load of money that could be spent like mining to get money
it protect itself by simply expect everyone will act in their self interest, AND ALIANGING such interest that it matches with the "right thing" they wanted you to do
it make attacks against the network very expensive, that no one want to commit such acts, and rewards these who mine to increase the security of it

right now in the paid to seed modal, there's conflicting interest
i can do the "right thing" and offer reasonable rates
Or i can be profitable by racking up sky high prices  
if enough people chooses option 2, let's just say we are all screwed

>no one will pay for seeding IF you can get it for free
That's also a problem to the whole paying structure if i choose to be generous just to mess up everyone's scheme to earn money, thus the paying feature will never be used ever again
i totally agree on that part, if the hash is same it wont need to redownload a content
